headline: Phillips 66 hit with $800 million penalty in biofuel trade secrets case
summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -U.S. refiner Phillips 66 was ordered to pay biofuel maker Propel Fuels $800 million in damages for stealing trade secrets to build up its renewable-fuel capabilities, according to a California state court document.  A state court in Alameda, California, on Wednesday ordered Phillips 66 to pay $195 million in punitive damages, in addition to $604.9 million in compensation the refiner was ordered to pay following a separate verdict.  In October, a jury in the California court decided that Houston-based Phillips 66 stole trade secrets under the guise of gathering information for a potential acquisition and then used that information to create a competing business.

content.title: Phillips 66 hit with $800 million penalty in biofuel trade secrets case
content.summary: NEW YORK (Reuters) -U.S. refiner Phillips 66 was ordered to pay biofuel maker Propel Fuels $800 million in damages for stealing trade secrets to build up its renewable-fuel capabilities, according to a California state court document.  A state court in Alameda, California, on Wednesday ordered Phillips 66 to pay $195 million in punitive damages, in addition to $604.9 million in compensation the refiner was ordered to pay following a separate verdict.  In October, a jury in the California court decided that Houston-based Phillips 66 stole trade secrets under the guise of gathering information for a potential acquisition and then used that information to create a competing business.

thumbnail.caption: A general view of the Phillips 66 refinery, as seen from Lone Tree Point, Rodeo, CA

headline: HF Sinclair beats profit estimates as refining margins soar
summary: (Reuters) -Refiner HF Sinclair beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit on Thursday as higher refining margins in the mid-continent region helped offset lower refined product sales volumes.  Shares of HF Sinclair were up around 1.5% by 11:22 a.m. EDT.  Top U.S. refiners are posting improved results in the second quarter, rebounding from first-quarter losses as stronger-than-expected diesel margins lift earnings.
